name: Purchased goods and services
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the actual numbers for each raw material purchased for business activities by GHG emissions intensity. The following databases were referenced ・ for GHG emissions intensity.  Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG ・ Emissions of Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6  Carbon Footprint ・ Communication Program, Basic Database Ver. 1.01 (Japan)  Carbon Footprint Communication Program, available data 3EID

name: Capital goods
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying capital expenditures for business activities by GHG emissions intensity. The following guidelines and databases were referenced for GHG emissions ・ intensity.  Basic Guidelines On Accounting for Greenhouse Gas Emissions throughout the Supply Chain Ver 2.3

name: Fuel-and-energy-related activities
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying energy used in business activities (fuel, supplied steam, electricity, etc.) by the GHG emissions intensity. The following guidelines and databases ・ were referenced for GHG emissions intensity.   GHG Emissions Calculation and ・ Reporting Manual (Ver 4.3.2)   Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG ・ Emissions of Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6   Carbon Footprint Communication Program Basic Database Ver. 1.01 (Japan)

name: Upstream transportation and distribution
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the GHG emissions intensity by the product of actual purchases of each raw material purchased for business activities and the distance transported (ton- kilometers). The following guidelines and databases were referenced for GHG emissions ・ intensity.   Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG Emissions of・ Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6   Carbon Footprint Communication Program, Basic Database Ver. 1.01 (Japan)

name: Waste generated in operations
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the waste discharged from business activities by the GHG emissions intensity. The following guidelines and databases were referenced for GHG ・ emissions intensity.   Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG Emissions of Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6

name: Business travel
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying business travel expenditures arising from business activities by the GHG emissions intensity. The following guidelines and databases were referenced for ・ GHG emissions intensity.   GHG Emissions Calculation and Reporting Manual (Ver 4.3.2) ・  Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG Emissions of Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6

name: Employee commuting
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying costs arising from employee commuting by the GHG emissions intensity. The following guidelines and databases were referenced for GHG emissions ・ ・ intensity.   GHG Emissions Calculation and Reporting Manual (Ver 4.3.2)   Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG Emissions of Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6

name: Upstream leased assets
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the number of days of use and the number of visitors of the upstream leased assets (facilities) used for business activities by the GHG emissions intensity of the facilities.
explanation: For emissions intensity of upstream leased assets (facilities) we used CO2 emissions and other data published by the lease providers.

name: Downstream transportation and distribution
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the GHG emissions intensity by the product of sales volume of products manufactured and purchased for business activities and the distance transported (ton- kilometers). The following guidelines and databases were referenced for ・ GHG gas emissions intensity.  Basic Guidelines On Accounting for Greenhouse Gas ・ Emissions throughout the Supply Chain Ver 2.3  Carbon Footprint Communication Program, available data (Japan) Ver. 1.04

name: Processing of sold products
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the commercial sales volume of products manufactured and purchased in connection with business activities by GHG emissions intensity. The ・ following guidelines and databases were referenced for GHG emissions intensity.  GHG ・ Emissions Calculation and Reporting Manual (Ver 4.3.2)  CFP-PCR: Processed food

name: Use of sold products
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the unit sales volume of products manufactured and purchased in connection with business activities by GHG emissions intensity. The following ・ guidelines and databases were referenced for GHG emissions intensity.  GHG Emissions ・ Calculation and Reporting Manual (Ver 4.3.2)  CFP-PCR: Processed food

name: End of life treatment of sold products
Emissions calculation methodology: Calculated by multiplying the waste of foods about general household, and packaging materials with products by the GHG emissions intensity. The following guidelines and ・ databases were referenced for the GHG emissions intensity.  Fiscal 2014, statistical survey report about waste of foods(by Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, ・ japan)   Emissions Intensity Database for Calculation of GHG Emissions of Organizations through the Supply Chain Ver 2.6

name: Downstream leased assets
explanation: The Group is not engaged in the leasing business. This status was confirmed during third-party verification for the reporting year, and the opinion was that we are not subject to calculation for this SCOPE.

name: Franchises
explanation: The Group is not engaged in the franchise business. This status was confirmed during third-party verification for the reporting year, and the opinion was that we are not subject to calculation for this SCOPE.

name: Investments
explanation: The Group is not engaged in the investment business. This status was confirmed during third-party verification for the reporting year, and the opinion was that we are not subject to calculation for this SCOPE.

name: Consumption of purchased or acquired electricity
Consumption of purchased or acquired heat
Consumption of purchased or acquired steam
Consumption of purchased or acquired cooling
Consumption of self-generated non- fuel renewable energy
